decks.notes: This Bant Aggro deck focuses on leveraging efficient creatures and disruptive spells to quickly pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan. The deck is built around cards like Knight of the Reliquary, Spell Queller, and Collected Company to apply pressure and control the board. The mana base and utility lands provide flexibility and consistency in casting spells and protecting your creatures. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, aiming to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling the combo pieces of Ad Nauseam, Angel's Grace, and Laboratory Maniac to win the game. By using cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to generate mana, the deck aims to draw its entire library with Ad Nauseam, then play Laboratory Maniac and win the game by drawing a card. The deck also includes protection spells like Pact of Negation and Phyrexian Unlife to ensure the combo resolves successfully. The land base is designed to support the combo while minimizing damage to the player.

This deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly with cards like Insolent Neonate and Faithless Looting, and then utilizing dredge cards such as Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug to continuously put cards into the graveyard and bring back creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. The key strategy is to abuse graveyard interactions to create a powerful board presence and win the game through overwhelming the opponent with recursive threats. The deck also utilizes cards like Life from the Loam and Conflagrate to help fuel the graveyard and deal extra damage to the opponent.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures to aggressively pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck utilizes powerful land cards like Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Tower to accelerate mana production and quickly play large threats like Reality Smasher and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive plays, ultimately leading to a quick victory through aggressive card advantage and tempo advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful, fast-paced aggro strategy by combining hexproof creatures with powerful aura spells. By protecting their creatures with cards like Slippery Bogle and Gladecover Scout, the player aims to quickly buff them up using a variety of auras such as Rancor and Ethereal Armor. The key goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large, evasive creatures that are difficult to deal with, while also providing protective spells like Leyline of Sanctity to ensure the opponent can't easily disrupt their game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Search for Tomorrow, Farseek, and Hour of Promise to cast Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle multiple times in one turn, dealing massive damage to the opponent. Cards like Wood Elves and Sakura-Tribe Elder help with ramping and fixing mana, while Prismatic Omen ensures all lands are Mountains, maximizing Valakut's potential. Relic of Progenitus and Lightning Bolt provide some interaction and disruption options. Overall, the deck aims to combo off and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck relies on counter spells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes land disruption and card draw to maintain control of the battlefield while maintaining a strong defensive position. The win condition can vary, from beating down with Celestial Colonnade to using planeswalkers like Gideon to create additional threats. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition while keeping the game under control at all times.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Spreading Seas and Detention Sphere. The win condition is to protect planeswalkers like Gideon and Elspeth, or to use Celestial Colonnade as a finisher. Card advantage is gained through Snapcaster Mage and Sphinx's Revelation, while Wall of Omens provides defense and draw power. The deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent, using a combination of control elements and powerful threats to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive Eldrazi creatures to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to use fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Gemstone Caverns to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule, and capitalize on their abilities such as Eldrazi Mimic and Reality Smasher. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and disruption to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Eldrazi lands and artifacts to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponents' spells while Walking Ballista provides flexibility as a removal or win condition. The deck's goal is to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and disruption, backed up by powerful spells like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Karn Liberated for late-game dominance. The inclusion of utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Sea Gate Wreckage adds versatility to the deck's strategy.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and lands. By playing multiple lands in a turn, the deck can trigger Valakut's ability to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to assemble the combo of Valakut, Primeval Titan, and Scapeshift to potentially take out the opponent in one turn. The deck also includes removal and graveyard hate to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It is essential to carefully manage resources and plan out the timing of key plays for optimal results.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Ghost Quarter. The deck aims to control the board with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher, while also having removal options with Dismember and All Is Dust. By efficiently deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the deck looks to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game with its powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn Liberated.

The deck revolves around quickly getting creatures onto the battlefield for aggressive attacks, using cards that allow for rapid card draw and discard, often leading to powerful creatures like Hollow One being cast for free. The deck also includes cards that can be cast from the graveyard, providing additional ways to get threats onto the battlefield. The main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, capitalizing on the deck's ability to quickly cycle through cards and deploy creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by using aggressive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thought-Knot Seer while also taking advantage of tax effects like Leonin Arbiter and Eldrazi Displacer. With a mix of disruptive creatures and removal spells like Path to Exile, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy and apply pressure with efficient creatures like Reality Smasher and Dark Confidant. The synergy between flickering creatures with Eldrazi Displacer and Flickerwisp adds another layer of disruption to the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up quickly using cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow, while controlling the opponent's graveyard with Relic of Progenitus. The goal is to cast Primeval Titan or through the breach to put Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle into play, and then trigger Valakut's ability by playing additional mountains to deal large amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Hour of Promise and Courser of Kruphix to generate additional value and ensure consistency in drawing into the combo pieces.

The key strategy of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by utilizing cards that tax their resources, such as Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Displacer. Aether Vial allows you to cheat out creatures at instant speed, and cards like Tidehollow Sculler and Flickerwisp provide additional disruption and flexibility. The mana base includes utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Shambling Vent to control the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt and overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggro and control elements.
